body_html:
@yyyreal @laventura I was able to solve this issue. I did the following:

  1. updated the CUDA driver to 367.57
  2. Installed CUDA 8.0 toolkit and CUDNN 5.1. Make sure to use -R with cp while copying cudnn library to cuda-8.0\lib64. Need to reboot after this. Check with nvidia-smi if proper drivers are installed and CUDA device is detected.
  3. Follow http://expressionflow.com/2016/10/09/installing-tensorflow-on-an-aws-ec2-p2-gpu-instance/ for tensorflow installation. (Note the newer version of tensorflow would require bazel 0.42(not 0.32 as mentioned in the post.) I used installer for bazel which worked fine.

After this TF should work with GPU.
